main_definition: Whereas is an idiom used to contrast two statements or ideas, indicating a difference between them.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To introduce a contrasting point or statement in relation to another.
meanings_and_examples.example: She enjoys painting; whereas her brother prefers playing music.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to compare two things that are different, often used when presenting alternatives.
meanings_and_examples.example: I like the new office location. Whereas some prefer staying in our current building due to its convenience.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To indicate a difference or opposition between two elements being discussed.
meanings_and_examples.example: Whereas cats are typically independent, dogs tend to be more loyal and social towards their owners.
